segments.text: My eyes are drawn to the boy on the wobbly stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He is stretching so high, reaching for that cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool's legs are visibly splayed, creating a very unstable base.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost feel the wobble from here; it looks ready to give way.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's so focused on the cookies, he doesn't seem to care about the risk.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a daring maneuver for such a young child.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope he doesn't lose his balance and crash down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The thought of him falling and getting hurt makes me very nervous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And falling onto a wet floor would only make it worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The lack of concern for his safety is quite alarming.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why aren't they more careful when an adult is present?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole situation is a recipe for disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's just milliseconds away from potentially taking a tumble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's such a bold and risky move for a sweet reward.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to brace the stool for him.
segments.speaker: PAR
